Class Lightbulb

java.lang.Object
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component
org.example.circuit_project.Components.Lightbulb
public class Lightbulb extends Component
Represents a Lightbulb component in the circuit simulator. The Lightbulb requires two connected ports forming a complete circuit loop, and a voltage difference across those ports to be considered "powered". When powered, its visual state changes to a lit bulb.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class org.example.circuit_project.Components.Component

    view, voltage

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    disconnect()
    Disconnects both input and output ports and resets the visual and voltage state.
    List<Port>
    getPorts()
    Returns the ports of this bulb: input and output.
    boolean
    isPowered()
    Checks whether the bulb is powered (both ports connected and voltage difference exists).
    void
    propagatePower(Set<Component> visited)
    Propagates power recursively from this bulb to downstream components.
    void
    reset()
    Resets the bulb’s voltage state and updates its visual.
    void
    simulate()
    Simulates the lightbulb logic: - Requires both input and output ports to be connected - Ensures ports are in the same loop - Powers the bulb only if voltage difference exists between ports
    void
    updateVisualState()
    Updates the visual appearance of the bulb (lit or unlit) based on power state.

    • simulate

      public void simulate()
      Simulates the lightbulb logic: - Requires both input and output ports to be connected - Ensures ports are in the same loop - Powers the bulb only if voltage difference exists between ports
